SEARCH
Package com.butlert.tradingcardmanager.controller

Class CardController

java.lang.Object
com.butlert.tradingcardmanager.controller.CardController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/cards") public class CardController extends Object
Main controller for the Trading Card Manager application.

This class acts as the REST API access point used by the GUI frontend to interact with the backend. It includes endpoints for adding, updating, deleting, retrieving, and importing cards, as well as generating statistics and value reports.

Author: Timothy Butler
Course: CEN 3024 - Software Development 1
Date: July 18, 2025

  • Method Details

    • addCard

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addCard(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid CardDTO cardDTO)
      Adds a new card to the system using the data provided in the CardDTO.
      Parameters:
      cardDTO - the data transfer object containing card information to be added; must be valid
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the result of the add operation, typically the created Card or an error response

    • deleteCard

      @DeleteMapping("/delete/{cardNumber}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteCard(@PathVariable("cardNumber") int cardNumber)
      Deletes a card from the system by its card number.
      Parameters:
      cardNumber - the unique identifier of the card to be deleted
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a completion message or an error response

    • updateCard

      @PutMapping("/put/{cardNumber}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateCard(@PathVariable("cardNumber") int cardNumber, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid CardDTO cardDTO)
      Updates the details of an existing card based on the provided card number and new data.
      Parameters:
      cardNumber - the unique identifier of the card to be updated
      cardDTO - the new data for the card; must be valid
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the updated card or an error response

    • getAllCards

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Card>> getAllCards()
      Retrieves all cards from the system.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a list of all stored cards

    • getCardById

      @GetMapping("/get/{cardNumber}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getCardById(@PathVariable("cardNumber") int cardNumber)
      Retrieves a card by its card number.
      Parameters:
      cardNumber - the unique identifier of the card to retrieve
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the card if found, or an error message if not

    • calculateCollectionStatistics

      @GetMapping("/stats") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Map<String,Object>> calculateCollectionStatistics()
      Calculates and retrieves various statistics about the current card collection.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a map of statistical values

    • calculateCollectionValue

      @GetMapping("/values") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Map<String,BigDecimal>> calculateCollectionValue()
      Calculates and retrieves the total value of the card collection.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a map with owner and market value data

    • importCardsFromFile

      @PostMapping("/import") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> importCardsFromFile(@RequestParam("file") org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file)
      Imports cards from the provided file and adds them to the system.
      Parameters:
      file - the uploaded text file containing card data
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the imported cards or an error message if upload fails
